p: This discrepancy may lie in the chosen instrumental variable and sample sizes. Genetically determined urate levels are largely defined by variation in SLC2A9 and ABCG2, which together explain ∼3.4% of serum urate concentration ( Köttgen et al., 2013 ). Most of the early MR studies of urate used SNPs in SLC2A9 only ( Facheris et al., 2011 ; Gao et al., 2013 , Simon et al., 2014). Kia et al. used GWAS-identified SNPs that explain 7% of urate variability and a two-sample MR design combining two large-scale GWAS studies, both of which improve statistical power ( Kia et al., 2018 ).
